stream_context.summary: Kaze live-planned new overworld content, refined technical systems, and chatted about design philosophy while iterating on "Return to Yoshi's Island." Main work focused on fleshing out overworld stars and a cave linking Rainbow Grotto.

development_findings.summary: Refactored SM64 audio engine, gaining ~12.5 % additional performance and expects more optimizations later.
development_findings.quote: I sped up audio code again by 12.5 percent at least somehow and I'm still finding new improvements.

development_findings.summary: Current plan is 180 total stars: 21 allotted to the overworld. Only 11 were planned; five more were added during stream, leaving roughly five yet to design. Considering raising cap to 185–200 if needed.
development_findings.quote: We need 10 more secret stars… maybe we just say fuck it and go to 200.

development_findings.summary: New overworld events will spawn NPCs after their level quests (e.g., Monty Mole blacksmith, Goomba King fishing, Shy Yoshis). These events double as star sources or flavor.
development_findings.quote: The Monty Mole Smith only becomes available after you beat the Monty Mole mission… I think that's perfect.

development_findings.summary: Designed a Yoshi egg star: egg hops after X stars, player breaks shell, baby Yoshi repays later or instantly if player is near end-game.
development_findings.quote: The egg is ready to hatch but he can't get out… come back one hour or, if you have 170 + stars, he instantly has the star.

development_findings.summary: Concepted harvesting/lottery minigame (watermelons or palm trees) to turn coins into chance-based stars, addressing coin-sink issue.
Planned secret cave star near Rainbow Grotto: one-way mirror window into level, glowing crystals as only light sources, possible zip-line segment; player carries light crystals to reveal path.
development_findings.quote: The mirror into the Rainbow Grotto is one way. You can see through the mirror from this side and look into the level.

development_findings.summary: Beta testing: Course 3 considered "very solid" after private test; Course 11 crashed due to render-function memory corruption but design feedback was positive. Kaze now distributes per-level ROMs for iterative feedback.
development_findings.quote: I fucked up and made the game crash… but what they did play showed all our designs were working as intended.

development_findings.summary: Animation overhaul planned: new quaternion-based format to enable squash & stretch beyond SM64's native system; not yet implemented.
development_findings.quote: I am hoping to eventually get quaternion animations in… the format that we thought up but I haven't implemented it yet.

development_findings.summary: Overworld geometry presently ~10 k polys in draft; final target estimated 50 k+ with improved lighting (new combiner) and terrain compression.
Legal/tech consideration: Still uses F3DEX3 microcode (license-unfriendly); any eventual PC port would omit microcode to avoid infringement.
development_findings.quote: If I was to ever make a PC port…the microcode would not be part of it.

context_findings.summary: Kaze has an 8-9-month-old daughter; thinks about limiting her future media exposure.
context_findings.quote: I have an eight-month-old daughter… I definitely feel like I have to be careful with what she's gonna watch on TV.

context_findings.summary: Sponsor video delayed because Squarespace backend failed to generate his code.
context_findings.quote: I was supposed to upload a video today, but Squarespace is slow as hell so my sponsor code didn't work.

context_findings.summary: Expressed strong dislike of original SM64 audio code, calling it "dog shit" and enjoying the refactor gains.
Outlined personal design philosophy he calls the "critics' dilemma": more content isn't automatically better; enjoyment metrics matter.
context_findings.quote: Because you build experience… you end up having to say you prefer games you didn't enjoy as much.

context_findings.summary: Shares casual opinions on AI art (likes it for satire), Zelda titles (prefers BotW over TotK), and politics; uses stream to test ideas.

biobak.summary: Reworking visuals for Divine Dino Domain; Kaze waiting on that before adding overworld tie-ins.
biobak.quote: Maybe once Biobak's rework is done, I would have some ideas for this.

biobak.summary: Suggested technical lighting improvements with a new combiner; Kaze agrees it will boost visual quality.
biobak.quote: Your new combiner will look a lot better.

biobak.summary: Co-developed idea of seeing behind the mirror into Rainbow Grotto.

key_stories.title: Audio Refactor Breakthrough
key_stories.summary: Kaze dove back into SM64's archaic audio engine and found another 12.5 % speed boost, surprising even himself.
key_stories.challenge: Original Nintendo code was inefficient and limiting CPU time.
key_stories.process: Systematic refactor and profiling during off-stream work.
key_stories.outcome: Game now runs leaner; Kaze still uncovering further gains.
key_stories.key_quote: The original audio is so dog-shit it's crazy— I sped it up by 12.5 % today.

key_stories.title: Overworld Star Shortage
key_stories.summary: The team needed ten more stars to hit their 21-star overworld target. On stream they brainstormed Yoshi-centric events and NPC migrations.
key_stories.challenge: Only 11 of 21 overworld stars existed, leaving large content gaps.
key_stories.process: Live white-board style: listing ideas like harvesting minigame, hatching egg, post-boss NPCs.
key_stories.outcome: Five concrete stars logged, reducing deficit to ~5; possibility of expanding total stars to 200.
key_stories.key_quote: We are planning the overworld events… I'm very sure we can do it somehow.

key_stories.title: Course 11 Beta Crash
key_stories.summary: A private play-test of Course 11 revealed stability issues caused by experimental renderer code.
key_stories.challenge: New render function corrupted RAM, crashing the level.
key_stories.process: Sent beta ROM to testers; gathered reports; traced crash to his test code.
key_stories.outcome: Bug isolated; confidence that level design is solid; plan to re-test.
key_stories.key_quote: Unfortunately I fucked up and made the game crash everywhere— RAM corrupted itself at runtime.

key_stories.title: Mirror Cave Secret
key_stories.summary: Making a bland cave meaningful, Kaze and chat designed a one-way mirror window that visually links Rainbow Grotto and hides a crystal-lit star.
key_stories.challenge: Cave felt empty and disconnected from surrounding lore.
key_stories.process: Iterated ideas (glowing shrooms, mine-tracks) until settling on one-way mirror plus light-carrying puzzle or zip-line.
key_stories.outcome: Card added to Trello; will host a secret star and environmental storytelling.
key_stories.key_quote: Daring today, aren't we? The mirror into the Rainbow Grotto is one way— you can see through it from this side.

open_questions.context: Kaze wants a new format to support squash & stretch but hasn't begun implementation.
questions: What is the rough timeline for integrating the quaternion animation format?
Who will be responsible for tooling and exporter updates?
Will existing animations need a re-author pass?

open_questions.context: Idea to let Wario sell a star for 1,000 coins; coins currently have minimal uses.
questions: How many high-value coin sinks are planned overall?
Could this break pacing for speed-runners or casuals?

open_questions.context: Concept of paying Yoshi to harvest watermelons/palm trees for a possible star.
questions: Will harvesting rely on RNG or skill?
How does it integrate with existing power-ups?
Which team member will script the behavior?

open_questions.context: Kaze floated moving from 180 to 200 stars if overworld ideas keep growing.
questions: Has the team agreed on a hard cap?
What QA workload does 200 stars imply?
Will additional stars delay release schedule?

open_questions.context: Uses F3DEX3 microcode; concerned about distributing or porting.
questions: Is there a concrete legal strategy for cartridge release vs. PC port?
Could open-source replacement microcode be funded?

open_questions.context: Stream featured mainly Kaze and Biobak; little about Badub or Zeina.
questions: What are Badub's current music deliverables and deadlines?
How will Zeina contribute animations once new format exists?
How often does the full team meet to sync progress?
